title: Group X - Cycling
description:
Group X classes are free, 45-minute long sessions that feature a variety of different formats, focusing on concepts like cardio, muscular strength and endurance, and flexibility. 
 How do I sign-up? 
 
 No registration required. 
 FREE for students with a valid Montclair State ID. 
 
 Where and when? 
 
 Tuesday, 09/02 - 12/17 
 10am - 10:45am 
 Student Recreation Multi-Purpose Room 2 
 
 Instructor 
 
 Jack

title: OPT Workshop - International Students (F-1 Visa Holders) Only
The Leadership Lounge
description: Students will have the chance to speak 1 on 1 with the Director of Bloomfield Campus Activities department. Topics can vary from event planning, student engagement, community service, volunteer opportunities, etc... Each session i s10 mins.

title: First Gen Drop-In Group
description:
This is a support drop-in group for first generation college students aimed to help ensure that first-gen students are empowered and prepared to reach their full social, professional, and academic potential. Students will have opportunities to build community, empower and support one another through shared experiences with topics that may include, but not limited to, lack of knowledge about college experience/resources, imposter syndrome, financial and family stress, academic struggles and other challenging subject matters. 
 Group Meets: 
 
 First group will be held on September 9, 2025 
 On Tuesdays from 11:30am – 12:30pm in the Health Promotion Drop-In Center 
 
 For more information, contact group leaders Ms. Charisma Jackson, LCSW at  jacksoncha@montclair.edu

title: MBA, Dual Degrees, & Graduate Certificates Virtual Information Session
description: Designed for Where You Want to Go Next Montclair’s  MBA programs  are built for professionals who are ready to lead with purpose—and back it up with strategy. Whether you’re climbing higher in your current role or ready to pivot into something new, our flexible, career-focused curriculum will help you build the skills, confidence, and connections to make it happen.  Registration is open for our  virtual information session November 18 at 12:00 PM (EST) . Join us to explore our MBA pathways and find the one that aligns with your goals.

title: Focus & Flourish: The Ultimate Study Skills Workshop
description:
Nervous about your Final Exams? Worried that you won't be able to retain the information while you're studying? Fear no more! Join us for our last event of the semester  Focus & Flourish: The Ultimate Study Skills Workshop!  Let us set you up for success so that you can finish your semester off strong! 
   What you will gain from this workshop: 
 -Identify Your Learning Style (Your Learning Superpower!) 
 -Memory Retention Strategies  
 -Note Taking Skills 
   
 RSVP TODAY!  We look forward to wrapping up the Fall 2025 semester with you!

title: The New American - U.S. Immigration History Workshop
organization: Bloomfield Office of International Student Services
description: Travel back in time and experience the journey of America’s immigrants! This workshop combines live performance and archival film footage to explore immigration stories from the 1800s and 1900s.

title: On View: The Age of Black Metal by Afrotectopia
description:
Embark on your own interstellar voyage in  The Age of Black Metal  by Afrotectopia. Admission is free, open to the public. 
   
 Segal Gallery 
 Tuesday – Friday, 12 – 4 pm 
   
 Kasser Lobby 
 Monday – Friday, 12 – 6 pm 
   
 We're also open on select Saturdays of the month and  by appointment . 
   
 About the Exhibition: 
 On view through December 14, 2025 
 Segal Gallery and Kasser Lobby 
 Black Metal  originated as a kitchen table art book that pushes the boundaries of space travel, science fiction, speculative design, Black culture, art, technology, and spirituality. The book emerged from an Afrotectopia-led incubator, in collaboration with MIT Media Lab’s Space Exploration Initiative and NYU’s Interactive Telecommunications Program. The project features contributions from artists Jordan Caldwell, Kordae Jatafa Henry, Jeremy Kamal, and Ari Melenciano. 
   
 The Age of Black Metal  builds upon the foundational ideas of the book and translates the text into a fully immersive experience for visitors to explore each conceptual chapter–from metaphysical training manuals, botanical consciousness, and self-alignment protocols–through participatory installations. The exhibition is set centuries in the future, imagining a timeline where society has been profoundly shaped by the principles of Black Metal. Ultimately, visitors will not only bear witness to the societal effects of Black Metal, but also leave transformed in some way.

title: Chess Club SB Meeting!
description: Chess club student body meeting! Come play chess and socialize with your fellow members! Chessboards will be provided; come at your convenience!
